title: Drawing, "Design for a Jacquard Woven Textile", ca. 1927
medium: Brush and watercolor, white gouache, pen and black ink on off-white wove paper
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite, top left, aligned to left margin: YK 135  (135 inscribed in circle).
Verso: in graphite, aligned to right margin (3 separate arrows): -->; in graphite, aligned to right margin above last arrow: 37.5; in graphite, next to top margin, aligned to rt. margin: 18.5; in graphite, faintly, at bottom right margin:   / Jacquard.
provenance: Gunta Stötzl, Switzerland, ca. 1927-1983; Yael Aloni, Tel Aviv, Israel, 1983-2010
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Rectangular sheet with a variety of geometric patterns: chevrons, squares, arrows, and triangles occasionally intersected by small blocks of color in a muted palette of sandy pink, dusty beige, taupe, gray, and brown with isolated dots or small squares of white gouache or red wash.
